im shocked I can't find a quick answer to this despite the many many science youtubers: what happens as we drink water? I find it astonishing that I can feel totally dehydrated on a hot day or after excercise, and then have a small glass of water and start profusely sweating, salivating and so on. The speed at which the whole body has a coordinated, instantaneous reaction to changes in water availability blows my mind. I would have thought it needed to be fully absorbed by some organ down there before anything substantively changed.
